title: I'm So F*cking Done with not having a say in my wins and losses
body:
Title says is all. 
I feel like as a top lane main there is so little that i can do to actually have an affect on the game unless i play someone with stupid amounts of wave clear and build a Zzrot. 

I hate seeing all these tanks with massive amounts of wave clear rush a Zzrot and just boost their wave clear to uncontrollable levels and winning without ever interacting with their lane opponent. 

I'm tired of the jungler being the only person who can make or break a game by either ganking bot over and over again making one team's bot lane irrelevant. 

I'm tired of seeing kat who has as much wave clear as ziggs at level 2 or leblanc who can instagib someone easier than ever. 

This season absolutely sucks!

Edit: People seem to think that I hate this game or think that I want to be able to 1v5 carry, I don't hate the game and I don't want to be able to 1v5 carry, I just want to feel like I make a difference to my team's outcome. Right now as it is top lane, the role I have mained since around season 3, does not feel that way.

replies.body: Thats why top laners have teleport so they can have a say?
except the tp channel increase was intended to stop top lane from tping bot for ganks so that's not an entirely viable strategy anymore

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QVoioXh6,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2017-01-05T17:23:05.275+0000)
>
> except the tp channel increase was intended to stop top lane from tping bot for ganks so that's not an entirely viable strategy anymore
When there is a deep ward it doesn't matter that the tp channel is 1 second longer... Just saying

ya but if it's a *deep* ward, you still have to walk up to the teamfight which takes even more time. Unless the enemy just walks into where you are tp'ing, in which case 
a) they already lost the fight and you're either late (the more common occurrence) or you get to clean up (in which case your team probably had it handled anyways)
or
b) they've already won the fight and are prepared to gang-bang you if you follow through with the tp

neither one is especially rewarding
You actually have deep wards in your games? Lucky...

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QVoioXh6,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2017-01-05T17:23:05.275+0000)
>
> except the tp channel increase was intended to stop top lane from tping bot for ganks so that's not an entirely viable strategy anymore

Oh right i forgot about that change.

Then play a different game. Sorry, league is not a game of 1v1 lane. It's a 5v5 team based game. If this does not appeal to you, that's fine. Just play a different game because this one is not suited to your interests. 

Not trying to belittle you either. Different people have different interests. If the team dynamic is something that bothers you, then LoL just isn't for you. There are plenty of other games that fill tthe niche you're looking for. No need to beat yourself up playing a game you don't enjoy

Honestly right now in this meta its less of a 5v5 and more of a "Whoever-can-4-man-bot-first-wins" It really sucks playing botlane right now. If your jungler doesn't put all the pressure bot lane you have almost no chance of winning. At least that's how it feels to me
whats worse is when a jungler camps toplane, its like whats the point?
I don't hate the game at all, I love league. My problem is that right now, my role as a top laner has so little impact on the game I might as well afk and see who wins.

This isn't the first time top has been like that and it won't be the last. Top lane has always been an island unto itself and the only time that ever changes is when something like Teleport comes into vogue. Which it did once, and then mid lane abused it as well and as a result you guys got shunted back to your island.

I don't mind the island so much, kind of the reason I started playing top. What I do mind is come time for team fighting the game already seeming lost because the score is something like one team being down 10+ kills at the 18min mark.
If you think it's bad in top lane, don't try coming bot lane.
It's like this. You have one person who gets absolutely no attention and another who gets ALL the attention.

I like the direction the jungle xp nerfs are going.
I hope Riot will stay on that road and fix the issues we've got going on down in botlane.
Win your lane and roam.  How does that not influence games?

I've seen so many top laners have a huge impact on the game.

Maybe you're just not as good as you think you are.

Well considering last season I held at least a 50% win rate with every champion I played top lane, aside from the one mundo game I played. I feel it is safe to say that I might be doing just fine with the role, but the game has evolved so that the role is much less of a factor compared to seasons past. 

[http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=DobbiesAFreeElf ]

If you want to make a big enough impact to decide whether you win or lose on your own, this isn't the game for you. No amount of single player skill is enough to beat 5 people--assuming they aren't all complete idiots/intentionally losing. 

Try Warframe. It has a solo mode.

So go play Rocket League 1v1.

{{champion:51}}
If you want more impact on the game play a carry top and use teleport to gank especially bot lane. I've picked up fiora and absolutely no one has outdamaged me in a game since then.

> [{quoted}](name=Kaioko,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QVoioXh6,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-05T14:44:28.394+0000)
>
> If you want more impact on the game play a carry top and use teleport to gank especially bot lane. I've picked up fiora and absolutely no one has outdamaged me in a game since then.

thats the worst way to actually win a game. carry top huh. lol

Best ways to play toplane IMO is win lane, push super hard, force people too respond and kill them all too. That, or just pray to jesus your team cana manage themselves.

heh.

{{champion:266}} 
share love mate.
Is that a new item?

I see a ton of people making this same complaint, but they never do anything to change it.  The bot supp doesnt keep deep wards in the enemies jungle to warn early of an incoming gank.  Bot lane doesn't back off and play less aggressive when the enemy junglers location is unknown and your jungler is top side or shows top side.  Your jungler see the enemy jungler coming to gank bot and instead does wolves/krugs.   The mid laner doesn't push in an opposing mid laner who really wants to roam on their level 6 powerspike.  The top laner sees bot clown fiesta going on but freezes their own wave because it will help them win their lane.  And they dont TP bot.  They dont call mias.

People always look to blame something else when something goes wrong, its just human nature.  They almost never look back at what happened and go, what could I have dont to change that.

This season is different, and if it wasn't you would still be complaining about something, like how stale the current meta was, how OP assassins were, etc.  You dont like tanks running zz'rot top lane??  How about the entire last season and a half where tanks were almost unplayable top lane because of {{champion:126}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:13}}  or bruiser{{champion:157}} / {{champion:245}} ???
I didnt read your paragraph, but im just thinking about how when I play jayce or kennen now I get camped super  hard. Gonna go main aatrox now.

Best roles to carry rn are jungle and mid, adc is in a bad position since assassin meta and anything being able to destroy them, supports decide the outcome of botlane most of the time, and top lane can't really make a difference until there are team fights or what not. I'm also really hungry rn.

I don't get how people think that ADC's aren't in a bad position. We've got these meta junglers like {{champion:120}} and {{champion:254}} who just take a fat dump on ADCs and these hyper tank top laners like {{champion:111}} and {{champion:83}} that just face tank a 6 item {{champion:51}} without a care in the world. I've been climbing as an ADC main, but I don't always hard carry and I can rarely carry enough to counter a feeding mid laner. Pretty much the only reason I'm climbing is because bronze ADCs are garbage, not because an ADC can hard carry a game.

Edit: Of course I get downvoted lol, the "ADC's are OP!" crew is everywhere.
Yorick is a juggernaut, not a tank. And he certainly can't be considered a "hypertank". Poppy would have been a better example.

Yorick is weird. Is he a tank? Not really, he diesn't have much cc or shieldings. 
Is he a Juggernaut? Sorta, he has no cc, situational damage and no healing.
Is he a fighter? No he isn't as reliable as Irelia or Fio
Q heals, W is a slow. CC is not a defining aspect of Juggernauts, anyways: Garden and Morde have no CC whatsoever.
W is his wall. The E is a slow.
Garen has a silence and I believe morde had a slow (dont't quote me on morde though because ive never played him)
He got literally no CC and he is buggier than release {{champion:268}} right now.

His q is a flat number hear that goes up to around 100 at max level (it scales off level and nothing else.)  W is just a breakable wall, E is a small slow with a small ms buff. 

I just mean other Juggernauts have some sorta survivability, Morde has his heals and shields, Garen has his passive tankiness and W.
yorick q heals. quite a bit actually. if ahead alot he's crazy. i once had a fight with him where i tanked so long 6 enemies died. in 5v5.... a once in a lifetime fight tbh.

Well if built right with high cd he survives just due to him being able to kite correctly and also Maiden damage is ABSURD (I two shot the enemy adc. Literall two shot, Titanic hydra AA and then Q Sheen. with maiden damage) 

And ye he survives alot but, without ghouls he doesn't really do alot that other champs can't do better.
i always just build triforce tank. and yes if both you and your enemy are equal in strength you're gonna lose without ghouls and maiden and win if you have them
With ghouls and  maiden you got like 200% fighting power xD
you're at a solid "1" rn
Made that edit when I was at a solid "0."
you complained about the "adc crew" downvoting you when you were only downvoted once...?
I mean, it's more of a trend thing really. Most of the times I make a post like this I get downvoted. Also, are you really critiquing a small comment over the actual content of what I said?
In general complaining about votes ends conversations right then and there. It doesn't matter what else you have to say at that point, its just derailed the conversation.

Just do what I did.

Play Tryn and start split pushing like crazy. It is the only way you can save a game when all other lanes lose/feed.

If they get caught out over and over, you lose. If they somehow 4man defend a turret, you win.

Far more entertaining than the usual island with zero impact.

The only other option is TP shen.

Zz'Rot is getting nerfed (currently on PBE).  

In some ways the game has always been this way (since Season One), jungle ganks bot lane repeatedly and make two people on the team irrelevant, not exactly anything new.  What complicates the problem more is the fact that bot towers are worthless and damage creep has made it so that you have no real means to defend yourself against a four (or even a three) man gank, then once you're behind there is absolutely no way to come back if your opponent has a pulse.  

So, I'll partially agree.  

When I started playing in Season One, if your midlaner fed a couple of early kills it may have sucked but you knew  that there was still a path to getting back into the game.  Now, once you're behind, you're boned.  Of course, people will say "but I was in a game once where we were 22 kills down and ..." exceptions to rules exist, but in general League is just too snowbally right now.
It's more like a net even change since the cooldown and duration are both getting lowered.
They nerfed it further this week, literally check the red tracker for the change and context.
